Switch Defines
[Optional Defines]

Collaboration diagram for Switch Defines:

Compiler defines which are used to tune APOXI framework to project needs. The switch defines are used to enable/disable the various "little" APOXI functionalities. More...

Defines

#define APOXI_HEAP_CONTEXT_USAGE
 shall not be set manually Adds a context vector per page which contains a context id of the object which is allocated, this is necessary for identification to which context an object belongs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

  Disables the address alignment to 64 K addresses

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ACCESS_CHECK
 Enables checking wrong frees (double called) and memory overwrites Enables checking wrong frees (double called) and memory overwrites. Take into account that enabling this define will have impact on memory consumption and runtime. It is set automatically under Win32. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf
#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ALLOC_TRACE
 Enables trace output of each allocate and free call Enables trace output of each allocate and free call, shall be used only under Win32 because very much trace output is done.
#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ASSERT_ON_FAILED_ALLOC
 Enables throwing an assertion when no memory can be allocated Enables throwing an assertion when no memory can be allocated.
#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE
 Enables collecting information about allocation done by Apps/Threads Enables collecting information about allocation done by Apps/Threads. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf
#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_DETECT_CONFIG
  Enables the detection of a suitable memory configuration For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf
#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_POOL_TRACE
 Enables collecting information of memory pages Enables collecting information of memory pages and allow tracing out a visual view of all memory pages on the trace interface. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf
#define APOXI_HEAP_NAME_USAGE
 shall not be set manually Adds a character array per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.
#define APOXI_HEAP_STATS_USAGE
 shall not be set manually Adds a statistics structure per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

  Enables new multi-color LED interface

  Prevent from active wait during reload of TPDUs

 Enables support of retrieving the concatenated SMS reference number Enables support of retrieving the concatenated SMS reference number of GFS 20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

 Enables support of ECC network list Enables support of retrieving ECCs over the air GFS 20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

 Disables the fast loading feature of the DR process and APOXI Disables the fast loading feature of the DR process and APOXI. This shall be only set for testing purposes.
#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_DELETION_CMD
 Enables support of the bulk deletion signal of DR-process Enables support of the bulk deletion signal of DR-process of GFS20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.
#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_DELETION_CMD_GORS
  Support +CMGD command to delete several SMS at once
#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_NEWMSG_PAYLOAD
 Enables support of the TPDU payload of incoming SMS signal of DR-process Enables support of the TPDU payload of incoming SMS signal of DR-process of GFS20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set. This allows processing the new arrived TPDU without reloading the TPDU from SIM or Flash.

Variables

def APOXI_DISPLAY_8BPP brief<

display is organized as bits
per pixel</i > Must be defined
if the display is organized

than one display is supported
and both displays have a different
bits per pixel 		setting

Detailed Description

Compiler defines which are used to tune APOXI framework to project needs. The switch defines are used to enable/disable the various "little" APOXI functionalities.

Optional defines are a kind of "little" features, often used for changing the behavior or adding - respectively enabling - simple options to a functionality (e.g. animated window titles).

Additionally it is possible to use the optional defines to disable an existing functionality or interface. In this case the name of these defines differ in their infix. In general it is a better approach to use a positive formulation, like to enable functionality, than to disable something. Please take care about that, every time you create a new define!


Naming convention for new created optional defines:

APOXI_ENABLE_<functionality>, where

  • <functionality> describes the functionality, which is enabled/activated.

APOXI_DISABLE_<functionality>, where

  • <functionality> describes the existing functionality, which is disabled/removed.

Define Documentation

#define APOXI_CBS_LIMITATION_MSG
 

Enables support of the MN_SMS_CB_MESSAGE_ID_LIMIT_IND signal Enables the support of the MN_SMS_CB_MESSAGE_ID_LIMIT_IND signal which indicates the maximum ranges of possible message IDs. This value is then posted via the message CbsLimitMsg.

#define APOXI_DEBUG_IMAGE_DECODING
 

Decreases the performance of image decoding to relieve debugging.

Decreases the performance of image decoding to relieve debugging. Setting this define is useful on the host environment to simulate a very slow hardware.

#define APOXI_DISABLE_ENLARGED_GRID_SELECTION
 

Disables the possibility of having an enlarged grid selection.

Disables the possibility of having an enlarged grid selection. Per default when having an item grid the selected items have the same size as the non-selected items. It is possible to define a larger selection height by the item renderer properties. In the case of an item grid this means that the selected item overlaps other items. If this is not required, it is recommended to define APOXI_DISABLE_ENLARGED_GRID_SELECTION to reduce the code size.

#define APOXI_DISABLE_FILTERED_SMS_PROVIDERS
 

Disables certain SmsProviders via define.

Introduced this new define in order to turn off code and according RAM consumption for the filtered SmsProviders (read/unread/sent/unsent) and leave the SmsProvider still available. The IDs for the disabled providers are still available (ProvIds).

#define APOXI_DISABLE_RECURSIVE_PROVIDER_SORTING
 

Disables the recursive QuickSort algorithm of the QuickSortProvider.

Activates the non-recursive QuickSort algorithm of the QuickSortProvider. Should be defined if there is a high risk of callstack overflow when sorting a large number of rows.

#define APOXI_DISABLE_SOFTKEYBAR
 

Disables the obsolete softkey bar.

Disables the obsolete softkey bar (see Window::GetSoftkeyBar). Per default the softkey bar is already defined as obsolete with APOXI-1.8.0. Setting this define is only required if the define APOXI_COMPAT_1_8_0 is required but no softkey bar support is wanted.

#define APOXI_DISABLE_TAB_CONTROL
 

Disables the tab control.

Disables the tab control. If is recommended to disable the tab control if the MMI does not use it, as it reduces the code size.

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_16BPP
 

Must be defined if the display is organized as 16 bits per pixel.

Must be defined if the display is organized as 16 bits per pixel. If more than one display is supported and both displays have a different bits per pixel setting, a custom display device must be implemented.

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_24BPP
 

Must be defined if the display is organized as 24 bits per pixel.

Must be defined if the display is organized as 24 bits per pixel. If more than one display is supported and both displays have a different bits per pixel setting, a custom display device must be implemented.

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_32BPP
 

Must be defined if the display is organized as 24 bits per pixel.

Must be defined if the display is organized as 32 bits per pixel. If more than one display is supported and both displays have a different bits per pixel setting, a custom display device must be implemented.

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_8BPP
 

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_FORMAT_BIG_ENDIAN
 

Must be defined if the pixels of the display are organized in big endian.

Must be defined if the pixels of the display are organized in big endian. If this define is not set, it is automatically assumed that the pixels are organized in little endian. Note that it is required to regenerate all APOXI bitmaps with the resource compiler if the endian format is changed.

#define APOXI_DISPLAY_PLANES
 

Must be set if the display is organized in planes format or is monochrome.

Must be set if the display is organized in planes format or is monochrome. If more than one display is used and both displays have a different color organization, a custom display device must be implemented.

#define APOXI_EM_CONTROL_ENABLED
 

Engineering mode control

This features enables the functionality of controlling the engineering-mode behavior in several ways. F.e. it is possible to lock to the current cell or a 3G to 2G handover can be triggered. The control-setting has influence to the data received with a EngineeringModeReport.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ADVANCED_TRANSLATION
 

Enables the advanced translation format.

Enables the advanced translation format, which increases the performance for the LanguageManager::ReTranslate operations. Also the ROM demand for the language table itself will be decreased. It is required to regenerate the language table with the APOXI Language Tool to benefit from the advanced format. Currently the advanced format does not work on EGold platforms.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ALPHA_BLENDING
 

Enables the alpha blending for drawing operations.

Enables the alpha blending for drawing operations. It is also required to enable alpha blending if an overlay of the display channel and video channel is required.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ANIMATED_TITLE
 

Enables support for animated titles inside a window.

Enables support for animated titles inside a window. As soon as the text of the title does not fit into the available width of the window, the scrolling is started.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_ANIM_TITLE_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ARC_DRAWING
 

Enables the drawing of Arcs.

Enables the drawing of Arcs when using the methods DeviceContext::DrawArc and DeviceContext::FillArc.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_ARC_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_C166_APOXIGUI_RAMCODE
 

Enables the execution of some gif decoding routines in internal RAM (for C166-based chipsets only)

The following routines: Color::Color Color::SetValue Color::GetValue Color::SetRgb Color::GetRgb Image::Draw are executed in internal RAM (APOXI_RAMCODE class) with 0ws access.

See APOXI_ENABLE_C166_DISPLAY_SHAREDMETHODS_RAMCODE for details on execution of code in RAM.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_C166_DISPLAY_SHAREDMETHODS_RAMCODE
 

Enables the execution of display device code in internal RAM (for C166-based chip sets only)

If this define is set, any piece of code between the following pragma directives if defined(APOXI_RTOS_OSE166) && defined(APOXI_ENABLE_C166_DISPLAY_SHAREDMETHODS_RAMCODE) pragma class PR=APOXI_RAMCODE endif { code } if defined(APOXI_RTOS_OSE166) && defined(APOXI_ENABLE_C166_DISPLAY_SHAREDMETHODS_RAMCODE) pragma default_attributes endif

is executed in the internal RAM of C166 MC. If the APOXI_RAMCODE data class is not defined in the linking option file (*.ilo), the pragma takes no effect.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_C166_GIFDECODER_RAMCODE
 

Enables the execution of some gif decoding routines in internal RAM (for C166-based chipsets only)

The following routines: GifDecoder::DecompressLine GifDecoder::DecompressInput GifDecoder::BufferedInput are executed in internal RAM (APOXI_RAMCODE class) with 0ws access. Enabling also APOXI_ENABLE_C166_APOXIGUI_RAMCODE, time to decode a gif is decreased for 25-30%

See APOXI_ENABLE_C166_DISPLAY_SHAREDMETHODS_RAMCODE for details on execution of code in RAM.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_C166_HUGEBITMAP_DRAW
 

Enables the draw of huge bitmaps (>64kbyes of data, for C166-based chip sets only)

This define has to be used when GDI_HUGE type is defined as _shuge but the APOXI Gui has to support drawing of images larger than 64kbytes. Typically GDI_HUGE=_shuge when physical display buffer is less than 64kbytes (e.g. 128x160 16bit display). Nevertheless images can be drawn also to a custom buffer larger than 64kbytes (e.g. when zooming option or full image display is implemented in MMI). In this case drawing fails if APOXI_ENABLE_C166_HUGEBITMAP_DRAW is not defined.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_C166_RECT_RAMCODE
 

Enables the execution of Rect class methods (Rect.cpp) in internal RAM (for C166-based chip sets only)

If this define is set, any piece of code between the following pragma directives if defined(APOXI_RTOS_OSE166) && defined(APOXI_ENABLE_C166_RECT_RAMCODE) pragma class PR=APOXI_RAMCODE endif { code } if defined(APOXI_RTOS_OSE166) && defined(APOXI_ENABLE_C166_RECT_RAMCODE) pragma default_attributes endif is executed in the internal RAM of C166 MC. If the APOXI_RAMCODE data class is not defined in the linking option file (*.ilo), the pragma takes no effect.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: RECT_RAMCODE
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_CBS_ACTIVE_TIMER_INTERFACE
 

Support of the active timer value of stack

This define enables setting the active timer value parameter which is supported by newer stacks.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_CIRCLE_DRAWING
 

Enables the drawing of circles.

Enables the drawing of circles when using the methods DeviceContext::DrawCircle and DeviceContext::FillCircle.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_CIRCLE_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_CONC_SMS_SCA_CHECK
 

Enables checking of the SCA in case of Concatenated SMS Enables checking of the SCA in case of Concatenated SMS, this means if the define is set also the SCA of a SMS will be used for checking if a TPDU belongs to a concatenated SMS.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_DBG_OUT
 

Enables the output of debugging information.

If this define is set, all debugging info implementation using macro DBG_OUT is enabled.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DBG_OUT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_DIAGONAL_LINE_DRAWING
 

Enables the drawing of diagonal lines.

Enables the drawing of diagonal lines when using the method DeviceContext::DrawLine.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_DIAG_LINE_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ECC_CUSTOMIZATION
 

Support of the ECC code customization

This define enables the interface for customization of the ECC codes which is supported by newer stacks.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_GSM_BITMAP_DRAWING
 

Enables the drawing of GSM bitmaps.

Enables the drawing of GSM bitmaps when using the method DeviceContext::DrawGsmBitmap.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_GSM_BITMAP_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_JAPANESE_TRANSCODER
 

Enables the Japanese transcoder, which allows to convert text stored in the UCS-2 format to and from SJIS, JIS or EUC.

Enables the Japanese transcoder, which allows to convert text stored in the UCS-2 format to and from SJIS, JIS or EUC. The Japanese transcoder is located inside Auxiliary and is represented by the class JapaneseTranscoder.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_ME_PHONEBOOK_REQUEST
 

Support of the ATC ME phonebook requests

This define enables the interface which allow processing ATC requests for ME phonebook entries reading implemented in newer stacks.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_MOC_CALL_RESTRICTION
 

Enables MOC call restriction.

Sometimes it is necessary to restrict the MOC-setup by other clients then APOXI. If a customer-MMI wants to restrict MOC's because of any reason this can be done by calling just a function in APOXI.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_POLYGON_DRAWING
 

Enables the drawing of polygons.

Enables the drawing of polygons when using the methods DeviceContext::DrawPolygon and DeviceContext::FillPolygon.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_DC_POLYGON_MAX_EDGES
  • APOXI_DC_POLYGON_MAX_EDGES_ON_STACK


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_POLYGON_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_POSITION_PREVIEW
 

Enables the preview of the menu position inside the title bar of a window.

Enables the preview of the menu position inside the title bar of a window. The currently selected icon is shown left from the menu title, the currently shortcut hint is shown right to the menu title. It is possible to customize the the look of the position preview by adjusting the class OptionalConfig (located in the directory 'Config' of the project). For further details have a look at the documentation for the class OptionalConfigBase, where the setting IDs 'ShowParentPosition' and 'PositionSeparator' are explained.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_ENABLE_ANIMATED_TITLE

#define APOXI_ENABLE_R2L_TEST
 

Treats A - Z as right to left characters.

Treats A - Z as right to left characters. Useful for testing the bidirectional text engine without the need to generate e. g. Arabic glyphs.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_ARABIC_TEST
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_RUNTIME_CONFIGURATION
 

Runtime configuration (e.g. via AT commands)

See also:
RuntimeConfigurator

#define APOXI_ENABLE_SDL_SIGNAL_SIGNATURE_CHECK
 

SDL signal signature check

This define asserts that signal-type and signal-size of SDL signal sent to APOXI are equal. It is just for checking if a SDL signal signature is valid or not.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_SIGNAL_COMPARE
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_SMOOTH_SCROLLING
 

Enables a smooth scrolling for menus and lists.

Enables a smooth scrolling for menus and lists. It is only recommended to turn on this feature on a fast hardware, as it requires a lot of performance.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_SMOOTH_SCROLLING_SUPPORT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_STACK_CHECK
 

Enables checking the system stack inside APOXI application containers.

If this define is set, APOXI invokes to checks the system stack (and in OSE166 also the user stack). Each application has a configured stack size and using a special fill pattern on top of each stack, APOXI is able to detect critical stack overflows or memory overwrites.

#define APOXI_ENABLE_SVG_FONT_SERIALIZATION
 

Enables engine mode for doing font serialization.

This configuration define is only required if a serialized font should be produced using SVG engine. This has to be done only once.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_SVG_FONT_SERIALIZATION
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_SVG_SYSTEM_FONTS
 

Enables support for system fonts in SVG engine.

Enables the usage of the internal APOXI font renderer in the svg engine. Only useful in combination with feature SVG


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_SVG_SYSTEM_FONT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_TIMING_MEASUREMENTS
 

Enables the usage of class DbgTimingMeasurement.

If this define is set, class DbgTimingMeasurement will be enabled to measure time periods and sending the result via DBG_OUT.

See also:
DbgTimingMeasurement

#define APOXI_ENABLE_TRAP_INFO_SCREEN
 

Redirects trap output to main display

If APOXI runs into an assertion the trap data is redirected to the main display.


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_CRASH_TO_SCREEN_OUTPUT
  • obsoleted define cleared out: 3.0

#define APOXI_ENABLE_USIM_PHONEBOOK
 

Enables the support of the USIM phonebook

Enables the support of the USIM phonebook and its interface inside APOXI. A UMTS stack with present PB process is required for compiling and operating the USIM phonebook.

#define APOXI_GDD_2_0_INTERFACE
 

If set, the APOXI display device will use the GDD 2.0 interface.

If set, the APOXI display device will use the GDD 2.0 interface instead of the outdated 1.0 interface.

#define APOXI_HEAP_CONTEXT_USAGE
 

shall not be set manually Adds a context vector per page which contains a context id of the object which is allocated, this is necessary for identification to which context an object belongs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

#define APOXI_HEAP_DISABLE_64K_ALIGNMENT
 

Disables the address alignment to 64 K addresses

This define shall be used for 32 bit processors like on ARM based platforms.

It will disable the following mechanism: On C166 platforms it is necessary when using HugeAllocation methods, so that blocks which are smaller then 64 K shall be also cast-able to SHUGE addresses which can address a maximum of 64 K, so that the pointer arithmetics are also working fine. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf

#define APOXI_HEAP_LENGTH_VECTOR
 

shall not be set manually

Adds a length vector per page which contains the real length of the object which is allocated, this is necessary for overwrite checks and additional statistics. Take into account that additional memory is used to held length information.

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ACCESS_CHECK
 

Enables checking wrong frees (double called) and memory overwrites Enables checking wrong frees (double called) and memory overwrites. Take into account that enabling this define will have impact on memory consumption and runtime. It is set automatically under Win32. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ALLOC_TRACE
 

Enables trace output of each allocate and free call Enables trace output of each allocate and free call, shall be used only under Win32 because very much trace output is done.

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ASSERT_ON_FAILED_ALLOC
 

Enables throwing an assertion when no memory can be allocated Enables throwing an assertion when no memory can be allocated.

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE
 

Enables collecting information about allocation done by Apps/Threads Enables collecting information about allocation done by Apps/Threads. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_DETECT_CONFIG
 

Enables the detection of a suitable memory configuration For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_POOL_TRACE
 

Enables collecting information of memory pages Enables collecting information of memory pages and allow tracing out a visual view of all memory pages on the trace interface. For detailed description please refer to the document: UserGuide_MemoryManagement.pdf

#define APOXI_HEAP_NAME_USAGE
 

shall not be set manually Adds a character array per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

#define APOXI_HEAP_STATS_USAGE
 

shall not be set manually Adds a statistics structure per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

#define APOXI_LED_NEW_INTERFACE
 

Enables new multi-color LED interface

LED driver provides two type of interfaces. This define has to be set to align the APOXI LED device interface with the driver interface. The define on driver side is named LED_MULTICOLOR_NEW_INTERFACE. If this define is not set, the old interface is enabled.


Define dependencies:

  • LED_MULTICOLOR_NEW_INTERFACE

#define APOXI_MEMORY_WIN32_REDIRECT_HUGEALLOCATION
 

Enables Redirection of HugeAllocations to Allocations under Win32 Redirects HugeAllocations to Allocations under Win32.

#define APOXI_SIMTK_TRANSACTIONID_SUPPORT
 

Enables support of Sim toolkit transaction Ids of GFS20 and GFS21 Enables support of Sim toolkit transaction Ids of GFS20 and GFS21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

#define APOXI_SMS_NEW_PROVIDERS
 

New SMS Providers

The new SMS providers are offering a fast sorting functionality that lists the newest SMS first place. By setting this define the old providers (Read/Unread/Sent/Unsent) get obsolete, as a result it isn't possible to use the old and new providers simultaneously. The following providers are available:

  • Inbox Provider: holds read/unread SMS
  • Outbox Provider: holds sent SMS
  • Archive Provider: holds unsent SMS
  • Status Report Provider: holds read/unread status reports
  • Unread Provider: holds unread SMS (incl. status reports)
  • Count Provider: delivers detailed count information (capacity/occupied/free) for both all items held by the providers above and in relation to the storage media (FLASH, SIM).

#define APOXI_SMS_NOWAIT_ON_RELOAD
 

Prevent from active wait during reload of TPDUs

Only storage media flash is affected. This mechanism can be switched off by setting this define. The interrupt is basically used to avoid blocking other processes which may result in crashing the system.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_CSMSREFNOREQ
 

Enables support of retrieving the concatenated SMS reference number Enables support of retrieving the concatenated SMS reference number of GFS 20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_MOSMS_TIMESTAMP
 

Enables support of retrieving time stamps of MOSMS Enables support of retrieving time stamps of MOSMS of GFS 20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_NETWORK_ECC_LIST
 

Enables support of ECC network list Enables support of retrieving ECCs over the air GFS 20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_NORMAL_SMS_LOADING
 

Disables the fast loading feature of the DR process and APOXI Disables the fast loading feature of the DR process and APOXI. This shall be only set for testing purposes.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_DELETION_CMD
 

Enables support of the bulk deletion signal of DR-process Enables support of the bulk deletion signal of DR-process of GFS20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_DELETION_CMD_GORS
 

Support +CMGD command to delete several SMS at once

This define enables the support of the AT command +CMGD. In TS 27.005, the command is specified with an optional <delflag> parameter that would control deletion of several SMS with one command. To support this also the define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_DELETION_CMD must be set.

#define APOXI_SUPPORT_SMS_NEWMSG_PAYLOAD
 

Enables support of the TPDU payload of incoming SMS signal of DR-process Enables support of the TPDU payload of incoming SMS signal of DR-process of GFS20 and GFS 21, for older stacks this shall not be set. This allows processing the new arrived TPDU without reloading the TPDU from SIM or Flash.

Variable Documentation

def APOXI_DISPLAY_8BPP brief<i> Must be defined if the display is organized as bits per pixel</i> Must be defined if the display is organized as bits per pixel If more than one display is supported and both displays have a different bits per pixel setting
